-ed (past tense): -age; -ware; -work (thing made from, possessing the quality of, or associated with)
(a young, not yet fully grown member of a species or group)
can; be able to; may (ability or permission)
in; at; on (a place, time, language etc.)
see; look; watch; look at; view
myself; yourself; himself; herself; itself; ourselves; yourselves; themselves; oneself (reflexive or emphatic)
for; toward; towards; for the benefit of
would (conditional mood, describing unreal or uncertain conditions and hypothetical situations)
so; thus; like this; in this way
wholly; wholely; entirely; fully; completely; quite; altogether
one; you (generic pronoun: an unspecified person or people in general)
number (quantity, amount, mathematical or grammatical concept)
number (position in sequence or identifier, e.g. of a house or phone)
who; whom; which; that (general relative clause marker)
then (at that time, in that case)
-er (someone who does something, whether currently, frequently, or professionally)
a; an; the (singular noun phrase marker)
sometime; someday; some day; one day
